title: Understanding Vulvar Cancer
subtitle: What it is, why it's done, and what to expect

content.value: Vulvar cancer is a type of cancer that develops on the external female genital area (the vulva), including the labia, clitoris, and skin around the vaginal opening. Although relatively rare, understanding it helps with **early detection** and **prevention**.

content.description: Most common in women over 60, often linked to HPV or chronic skin conditions

content.value: Vulvar cancer usually starts in the skin cells covering the vulva. Understanding the different types helps with early recognition and treatment.

items.title: Squamous Cell Carcinoma
items.description: 85-90% of cases, begins in flat cells

items.title: Pre-Cancerous Changes VIN
items.description: Can be prevented with early treatment

content.title: Early Detection Matters
content.description: Detecting VIN early and treating it promptly can prevent it from developing into vulvar cancer.

items.title: Smoking
items.content: Weakens immune system, increases HPV persistence

items.title: Weakened Immune System
items.content: Reduced ability to fight infections and abnormal cell growth

items.title: History of Cervical/Vaginal Pre-cancers
items.content: Previous abnormal cell changes increase risk

content.title: Understanding Risk
content.description: Having risk factors does not mean you will get vulvar cancer â€” understanding them helps with early detection.

items: A cut or sore that won't heal
A lump or mass on the vulva
Changes in a mole or birthmark

content.title: Warning
content.description: If you notice any of these symptoms, see your doctor promptly.

steps: Pelvic Exam - checking vulva, vagina, uterus, ovaries for abnormalities
Biopsy - removing small tissue piece to test for cancer cells
Colposcopy - magnifying instrument to closely examine vulva

items.title: Surgery Options
items.content: Radical Wide Local Excision, Radical Partial Vulvectomy, Radical Vulvectomy

content.title: Treatment Approach
content.description: Treatment depends on stage, size, and spread of cancer. Surgery is most common.

items.text: Early treatment of vulvar skin conditions
Be aware of any vulvar skin changes

content.title: Early Detection
content.description: Early detection makes treatment more effective. Regular check-ups help catch changes early.

items.text: Persistent itching/lumps/skin changes should never be ignored
Regular check-ups help spot changes early

content.value: **Staying aware, getting regular check-ups, and seeking help early can make a powerful difference.**
